article.description: James Augustine continues to shine in the postseason for top-seeded Illinois.

related.description: Some 16 years after he got the Illini in NCAA trouble, Illinois fans still haven't forgiven Bruce Pearl.
related.title: Illinois-UWM puts Pearl back in the spotlight
related.headline: Illinois-UWM puts Pearl back in the spotlight

article.headline: Illinois overwhelms Nevada; UW-Milwaukee next
article.linkText: Illinois downs Nevada to advance to Sweet 16
article.story: RENO, Nev. (AP) -- Nick Fazekas and Marcelus Kemp scored 25 points each to lead No. 22 Nevada to a 78-72 victory over Humboldt State on Saturday night in an exhibition game. Mo Charlo added 11 points for the Wolf Pack, which opens their regular season Nov. 19 at home against Sacramento State. Grayson Moyer had 22 points, Kevin Johnson 19 and Jeremiah Ward 14 for the Division II Lumberjacks. Humboldt State built an 11-point lead in the first half, hitting seven 3-pointers. Moyer's 3-pointer with 8:10 left in the half put the Lumberjacks ahead 29-18. Nevada rallied with a 19-8 run to end the half tied at 37. Fazekas also had 11 rebounds for the Wolf Pack, who led by as many as 12 points in the second half. Kemp's basket with 3:44 left to play put Nevada ahead 74-62. Humboldt State went on a 10-0 run and pulled to within 74-72 with 28.8 seconds left. Lyndale Burleson and Kemp each hit a pair of free throws and Demarshay Johnson had a key steal with 14.6 seconds left to seal the victory for the Wolf Pack.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
